message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Compile a comprehensive list of U.S. wildfires that caused no less than 10 deaths between 2000 and 2024 (including 2000 and 2024). I need information about:
Event 
Primary State Affected (If there are multiple affected states, separate them by comma)
Death Toll
Acres Burned
Number of Structures Destroyed
Start Month (YYYY-MM)
Damage (Billion USD)
If any information you can't retrive online, just output "-".

Please output the organized data in Markdown table format.
The column names in the table should be, in order:
Event, Primary State Affected, Death Toll, Acres Burned, Structure Destroyed, Start Month, Damage(Billion)

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is: 
 ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

To compile the requested comprehensive list of U.S. wildfires that caused at least 10 deaths between 2000 and 2024, I need to find specific details on each event.

<search>U.S. wildfires causing at least 10 deaths between 2000 and 2024</search>

Search query: U.S. wildfires causing at least 10 deaths between 2000 and 2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41597-025-06226-8):
Two and a half decades of United States wildfire burn zone disaster ... ... U.S. wildfire burn zone disasters between 2000–2025. The annual number of these disasters ranged between 61 in 2001 and 570 in 2011 (median ...

[Doc 2](https://www.climate.gov/news-features/blogs/beyond-data/2024-active-year-us-billion-dollar-weather-and-climate-disasters):
2024: An active year of U.S. billion-dollar weather and climate ... In 2024, there were 27 individual weather and climate disasters with at least $1 billion in damages, trailing only the record-setting 28 events ...

[Doc 3](https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/2025/09/18/wildfire-smoke-deaths-climate-change/):
See where wildfire smoke is getting worse in the U.S. A new study shows wildfires are causing more than 40,000 premature deaths per year — and that rising temperatures will lead to even more.

Based on the above information:

<search>Top US wildfires causing at least 10 deaths between 2000 and 2024</search>

Search query: Top US wildfires causing at least 10 deaths between 2000 and 2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.singletonschreiber.com/theblog/the-largest-wildfires-in-u-s-history):
The Largest, Deadliest, and Costliest Wildfires in U.S. History 25 wildfires in US history have killed at least 10 people, including Hawaii's Lahaina fire of 2023 and major California fires in 2017, 2018, and 2020.

[Doc 2](https://earth.org/worst-wildfires-in-us-history/):
17 Largest Wildfires in US History - Earth.Org 1. Texas Wildfires (2024) · 2. Maui Wildfires, Hawaii (2023) · 3. Dixie Fire, California ( · 4. Bay Area Fire, California (2020).

[Doc 3](https://wfca.com/wildfire-articles/deadliest-wildfires-in-us-history/):
Deadliest Wildfires in U.S. History | WFCA The Lahaina Town wildfire on the Hawaiian island of Maui is considered to be the deadliest in United States history in more than a century.
